It’s our commitment to provide our District community with clarification around our Return to School Health & Safety and Education plans. While we work on updating the FAQ section of our website(www.northallegheny.org/Page/32444), we wanted to answer common questions.

According to the Pennsylvania Department of Health, a "Face covering" means a covering of the nose and mouth that is secured to the head with ties, straps, or loops over the ears or is wrapped around the lower face. A "face covering" can be made of a variety of synthetic or natural fabrics, including cotton, silk, or linen, and, for the purposes of the order, can include a plastic face shield that covers the nose and mouth. Source: https://bit.ly/3fYe494

April is deemed School Library Month by the American Association of School Librarians' to celebrate school librarians and libraries. Each year in April, school librarians are encouraged to host activities to help their school and local community celebrate the essential role that strong school libraries play in transforming learning.

Because of COVID-19, this has proven to be a challenge, however, NA’s librarians were up to the task. Curating resources to help with the transition to remote learning, recording read-alouds, moderating book discussions, and collaborating with public libraries to expand digital access are just some of the ways our librarians have helped students, families, and our community!

post_text: This week, the Technology Services Department implemented a Remote Learning Check-In app intended to allow students to check-in for daily attendance. On Tuesday, November 12, 2019, the NA chapter of Students Against Destructive Decisions (SADD) partnered with the Pennsylvania DUI Association and the Allegheny County Alcohol Highway Safety Program/DUI Pretrial Services Department to bring the Safety SIMulator to NASH.⁣
⁣
The Safety SIMulator provided a virtual driving experience for students to learn about safe and responsible driving. This unique experience allowed students to drive under many diverse and adverse conditions, including snow, fog, and heavy traffic. It also allowed students to see how alcohol impairs the ability to steer and brake, and highlights the dangers presented to everyone when other drivers are impaired. ⁣
⁣
SADD hopes that the lessons in safe driving and experience with the Safety SIMulator will have a positive impact upon the participant’s future decisions, and help prevent risky behaviors. #NASDlearns

The NAI Tiger Shop is at it again! Students at NAI have made yet another generous donation to a local non-profit with proceeds from the Tiger Shop.

The Tiger Shop is a student-run shop that operates in the hallways at North Allegheny Intermediate High. Students sell snacks during the school day to peers and staff members, then donate their proceeds to benefit local non-profits. Students are also responsible for counting money, creating budgets, and purchasing products to sell. This unique opportunity allows students to use functional and social skills that they learn with the school community.

On Tuesday, February 18, 2020, a $1,000 donation was presented to Jamie's Dream Team. This donation will go toward the 4th annual Ryan’s Flight Disney Extravaganza, a trip planned by Jamie's Dream Team that will send several children in need, all of whom are living with severe intellectual disabilities or who are on the severe autism spectrum, and their families on an all-inclusive trip to Disney World.

Great job, Tiger Shop! 👏🐯
